website_summaries.verdict: Slightly higher price and additional features make this a great combo golf/fitness tracker for everyday users.
pros: Measures shot distances with Garmin Connect for post-game analysis
Metrics help your swing consistency and display steps taken, calories burned, hours of sleep in addition to golf stats
cons: Batteries may not hold charge well/may freeze
Software glitches at times without finding nearby courses

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Scam
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch but it does not have pre loaded courses on it. When I call Garmin customer support they said I would have to pay $75 to have them “unlock” it si it would load courses. I could NOT believe this. I am returning the watch for a refund NOW. Worst scam I have ever seen. Will never buy another Garmin product. Ever!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia K. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate....
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was just getting distance, and then I synced it to my phone. I didn't realize it could track every shot on every hole. Great feature to review your round after you play. Unfortunately (see pic) I'm a bad golfer:)
customer_reviews.author: AMG Manager

customer_reviews.title: Seamless integration into golf game.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is fantastic for golf. It does tell the time so you can wear it elsewhere and not stick out. The watch fits my golf game seamlessly, allowing me to leave my phone in my bag or cart. It does not slow down the rate of play whatsoever, you can mark your score and hole details while walking from the green back to the cart. I can not stress enough how useful this watch is. Accuracy is pretty spot on with range finders especially considering you can easily adjust where the pin is located on the green
customer_reviews.author: WontonSoup!

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch but highly complicated. Has features you will never use on the golf course. Inconsistent operation as well. Had an earlier Garmin that I wish I had back.
customer_reviews.author: Payton

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch as a gift for my father and it stopped working (tracking ball distance) after just one year. For a $200 watch that is completely unacceptable. I'm going through the process of a repair with Garmin but I don't have high hopes, I will update this review if they do, in fact, do a repair that fixes the watch.
customer_reviews.author: asny1234

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: If you are NOT interested in the correct yardage on the golf course, then this is the watch for you! I have used it on about ten different courses and my home course 12 times. The yardage displayed can be off as much as 20 yards from on-course monumentation. The error appears to be non lineal as the error constantly changes over the course of a round.
customer_reviews.author: WDM

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault the watch .It's light and comfortable to wear.My first one so i can't compare it to competition. I had it almost 3 weeks before i used it on the course and original battery charge was still good. Distances accurate once I changed the units to yards from metric. Some reviews say the the manual is confusing but operating is self explanatory I thought. Up and down buttons to find desired setting ok to select .Buttons do require a good push and you probably need to support the opposite side with thumb unless its very tight on the wrist
customer_reviews.author: Mr JJ Traynor

customer_reviews.title: Ball distance, very unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The distance function is very unreliable. Sometimes will not start when the ball is struck, sometimes times restarts when someone else hits their ball, sometimes works on drive but does not restart on 2nd stroke. I have no idea how the sensor works to start measuring the shot. When a shot is hit onto the green, sometimes it resets before you can get you final measurement. Sometimes it does not advance to the next hole. Very unreliable. This dors not happen all the time but enough to not recommend this watch at all.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Cordeiro

customer_reviews.title: It's great for golf.
customer_reviews.text: This is 1 of 4 Garmin watches I've tried. Best one for golf. Works with ct10 sensors much better than the s60 approach. But I only use it for golf. I keep the s60 on for all day everyday use as it works better with phone notifications. If all you want is a golf gps and tracker. Get this. Any more and I would suggest vivoactive 4
customer_reviews.author: squizzelnuts

customer_reviews.title: Easier to read/use
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for my earlier Garmin (the strap broke, and it was integrated into the watch...which means I can't replace it). The screen is much easier to read, the power connection to the watch is much better (firmer, less likely to disconnect), and the watch strap can be replaced....thus I don't have to throw it out when the strap breaks! I like the hazard feature, but it hasn't worked reliably....still new to me...so I'm hopeful it will help. Not sure how long the power lasts as I've recharged it after every use so far. I've owned it for about 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Hager

customer_reviews.title: Great on the golf course and off.
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it updates with the courses, and it is readable and accurate when I am out playing. These days I don't play due to covid but I use it for a step count when I go out for exercise, it keeps track all day. When I use it for golfing it drains the battery due to GPS and I have to charge it every few games. However when I don't use the GPS it can go for months without recharging. I like the fact you don't need an app to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Roba66

customer_reviews.title: It is a great product, as I have stated
customer_reviews.text: Hello, well, I have to tell you that the Approach S20 is too technical for me. It is capable of accomplishing many functions that I do not need. Accordingly, I sometimes have to go through too many procedures to get what I want. My needs are primarily hole details and I have not even mastered the details that are between the tee and the hole. It is a great product , as I have stated, too technical for me.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yeokum

customer_reviews.title: So far, I'm not overly impressed
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm not overly impressed. I like the look & large display, however, the yardage seems to be off by up to 15 yards at times- inconsistent. I selected this GPS watch because the info said it gave distances to hazards. To obtain hazard distances is too time consuming & convoluted to use while playing. I plan to give it another few rounds to determine if the yardage is truly that incorrect, if so, I will return it. Also, the 20 inch charging cable is way a too short to reach from an outlet to a table.
customer_reviews.author: Loving it in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great sync to Garmin Golf AP
customer_reviews.text: It has been a great purchase for golf and everyday use. I especially like that you can sync it with the Garmin Golf AP and keep lots of helpful statistics. I really like that it stores all your shots and you can replay the round of golf on each hole visually. I wish it gave an exact measurement to the pin, but the front/middle/back yardage readings are quite helpful and fairly accurate. Battery life is outstanding. I only need to charge it once a week which includes a couple of rounds of golf.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth K

customer_reviews.title: My husband, the golfer, loves this
customer_reviews.text: This was on my husband's list for his birthday. I did some reading on the various brands and their usability. This seemed to be the best fit for my husband who is not the geeky gadget type. I helped with the set up and he has been using it for several months and loves it. The battery is long lasting, the charging is easy. He has been asked by several fellow golfers about the watch as they liked it too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Button fell off the watch
customer_reviews.text: I am from an island in the Caribbean - ANTIGUA. That being said, I have to use a freight forwarder in Miami to generally receive items from Amazon. I received the watch barely in time for Christmas, but I was still so excited to present this gift to my boyfriend who is getting involved in the golf scene. On Christmas morning he unwrapped his present and was totally in love with the idea of being able to utilize the watch during his games. Unfortunately, while programming the watch, a button fell out of the socket making it impossible to further utilize the watch. We are so disappointed. Definitely sending this back and requesting my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Natalia B.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, accurate Golf GPS watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my father in law as a gift, he hasn’t taken it off since! We play golf regularly and he was always interested in a similar watch I have which tracks my round. This watch was at a great price so I decided to buy it for him. He is nearly 60 and figured out how to use the watch in no time at all. The good thing about this watch is it doesn’t have to just be worn when golfing. It will count your steps, show how many calories you’ve burned, and believe it or not it does actually tell the time!
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS watch that is fun on the golf course....
customer_reviews.text: Got this watch for Christmas. I have logged a good number of rounds on it and love it. It pretty accurate when going side by side with other GPS users. The battery life is excellent - I don't use the mobile app much so I get 2-3 weeks easy, several rounds of golf included before I need to charge the battery. It is a great value....love the reminder to "MOVE" when I have been idle too long!
customer_reviews.author: Willie S. Tyndall Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for hubby so he could use it playing golf. He's not much of a techy so I was skeptical about whether he would really utilize it, but he loves it. Even began using a lot of the other features besides those for golf. The only challenge we had was trying to reset the time after it automatically adjusted for DST (we live where time doesn't spring forward or fall back). Following the directions never seemed to work, so we had to take it to an "expert" (younger person) to reset it. Shouldn't be that difficult. :-( Otherwise, he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Janice L.

customer_reviews.title: Crappy customer (Amazon Vendor) support - Good Garmin Product support
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the watch the 3 times I used it. On the 4th use, the GPS would not locate the golf course I was playing - The Amazon vendor would not do an exchange or refund. However, I was able to call Garmin product support directly and Garmin is exchanging my watch for a new one. I'm grateful the company is standing behind their products....
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Weber

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this gps golf watch for six rounds of golf at four different golf courses and it has performed great. Other players had laser finders and had trouble (locking) on to the flag, but when they did, this gps was always spot on with their yardages and all I had to do is glance down and read the yardage!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Got a deal on prime day. Does not have touch but user interface is easy through the buttons. Seems like a little long before it gets its first gps fix but works great once it does. Has a cool app for the phone which can be synced so you can review your shots. See photos.
customer_reviews.author: Steve STop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This was the 2nd gps i purchased as the 1st off brand one did not operate well. This garmin watch is excellent. Speedy gps, constant location accuracy, keeps track of shots decently (works well if you dont mishit a bunch if shots lol), and allows you to track your score as you go.
customer_reviews.author: TTuckF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This watch works perfectly. I have golfing buddies that had range finders and watches and they all agree that this model works the best at providing range information and keeping score. It is also nice that it can provide the information to your phone if you install the app.
customer_reviews.author: cdub

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase
customer_reviews.text: This and its ancillary software products simply do not function as promised or advertised. I have now used this product for over 20 rounds, no two functioning the same. It is sadly a waste of money and for my wife, am getting a completely different product. If you want complete frustration, buy this. If you want to enjoy your game of golf then pass.
customer_reviews.author: Arabica

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a wrong piece.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work so returned it. Bought an Approach S 60 which is fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Golfer

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate yardage. Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different watch that was color with all the bells and whistles and the yardages were off by 1 or 2 club lengths. I returned it for this unit and couldn't be happier. the yardages shown were spot on!!. very happy with jay purchase and would recommend a Garmin GPS golf watch to everyone asking. I'd love to have the S62 but it's just more golf watch than I can afford. This unit is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use and comparable accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: This watch is now taking the place of my Bushnell range finder. Not exactly as accurate but within 3-4 yards. Easier to use since I don’t have to take it our of it’s case shoot the flag and then put it back in the case. Seems to find and keep up with each hole pretty well. Scoring is a little bit of a pain, but I used it way more for distances than scoring.
customer_reviews.author: BJF

customer_reviews.title: My first GPS, so okay I guess
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work reasonably well although it doesn't always register each shot and sometimes misses entire holes. Easy to correct when I get home on my computer. Doesn't have all of the different tees for each golf course, but yardage is still accurate from the tee that I do use. I haven't learned how to use many features but I like that it gives me yardage to hazards and that when I get home I can easily mark putts. From what I've seen other players go through with more expensive watches and even range finders, I would recommend this GPS as a better value and kind of fun.
customer_reviews.author: longtime

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product that has helped my game
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate and a great item to have when playing a round of golf. Not a touch screen but the buttons work just fine. Sometimes can take a couple minutes to acquire the satellite so just turn it on when arriving at the course. Really has helped my game. Not very fashionable so everyday wear will vary person to person. Side note the garmin customer support is top notch. Would highly recommend to anyone that plays golf and is looking for that added help.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Battery was completely discharged when it arrived, minimal padding in the shipping box
customer_reviews.text: Watch arrived yesterday evening. Opened it up and tried to turn on. Battery was completely discharged. Charged to 100% and installed updates. Left it in watch mode. This morning battery was down to 50% at 9 am, it is now 23% at 1:30 pm. I have left it in watch mode all day. I don't see how it could last for a 4 hour round of golf in GPS mode with this battery. Don't know what is wrong but I am extremely disappointed. Going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't ask for one better. Pretty accurate for distance
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't ask for one better. Pretty accurate for distance. Ability to adjust pin placements and hazards. Recognizes the five different courses I've played so far (amongst many others, including a 9-hole right around the corner). Saves your rounds that you can access through a free Garmin app. It also acts a bit like a Fitbit; with sleep and steps. Finally the battery...long lasting. I went over a week without a recharge, including 2 rounds of golf. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lil Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: If your a golfer it’s worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great for the money , battery life is good. Pretty accurate and picks up satellites quick. Not sure how often it’s updated I just played on a course that was changed last year and it still showed the old holes. Very user friendly . No adjustment for elevation- no big deal for a novice player. If your on the fence buy it you will love it. Sleep tracker not accurate
customer_reviews.author: Jfirefighter4life

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This Garmin replaced the Garmin golf watch I had worn for eight trouble-free years. Accuracy is good and it has loaded every course I have played, no problems. The only issue I have is the wrist band. On my previous Garmin the band was more comfortable and kept the watch face flat on my wrist. Not the case with the Garmin Approach. But this is not a deal breaker. Still like my Garmin and would be lost on the course without it.
customer_reviews.author: CLI

customer_reviews.title: Product is very light weight and does as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The GPS watch does as advertised but is a little cumbersome with the scoring and measuring the distances of clubs. After using this watch for a few months, I had to change the ratings to a one star from the original four stars. I can't stand the score keeping interface and the fact that the shot measuring feature is tied to the scoring feature. Almost unusable. Very dissatisfied with this watch and would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mbs47

customer_reviews.title: Best if you are new to Garmin golf watches.
customer_reviews.text: I owned an earlier generation Garmin golf watch which I thoroughly loved. So I was surprised by how different the operational button configuration was on this newer item. I have found it frustrating that my prior knowledge seems to get in the way of its ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S Maher

customer_reviews.title: Nice GPS Golf Watch
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had three Garmin golf watches. I like this one the best. 1- Good battery life 2- Easy to use 3- Gives distances to hazards 4- Good value. 5- Fit nicely and is small. 6- Easy to read
customer_reviews.author: J. Ferrando

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Bag
customer_reviews.text: This item has been in the marketplace for a while now. I can't believe how lousy the documentation is. Nothing about this item is intuitive. Paper and online docs stink. The device syncs to two phone apps via bluetooth. I fail to understand how to use those apps and what benefit they provide. I'm not going to give up. I'll keep fumbling an re-reading the docs and try to determine how it will make me a better golfer.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Lot of stuff and complicated. No touch screen.
customer_reviews.text: Prefer my old Garmin golf watch. I bought a new one because the battery is starting to go on the old one. There is no touch screen on this new watch. Just a back and forward button. Too many options and confusing to use. Just starting to figure it out. Battery life is very good though. Played 36 holes with no problem. Be sure to update the courses when you first use it. Number of courses didn’t come up. Searches for the course for a long time so start it at the range.
customer_reviews.author: Wally in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life and provides useful on course and post round metrics.
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life! My first charge to 40% lasted well over a week, with one round being played in that time. Rest of the time it was in activity mode. It’s a little clunky to use , but gets easier. In conjunction with the the app downloads , they work well to give feedback on metrics like distance position and strokes . The yardage meter was ok , I still used my rangefinder , but it gave you a good idea of the general yardage to front back and middle . I’m happy with it and would buy again. There may be better more updated models with better features. But this works good enough.
customer_reviews.author: jean d.

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the battery indicator?
customer_reviews.text: No battery indicator unless you turn the watch off or unplug the charger. And, no notice once the battery is charged. That makes no sense to me. With all the functionality this watch has, you would think Garmin would add at least have a setting to check the battery. For that reason, I’m only giving it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS watch
customer_reviews.text: This thing has more features than I use. I play golf 5 days a week and the battery has lasted the whole week -- most of the time. The distances are fairly accurate. I've checked it against a laser range finder. Unfortunately the flag position on the greens are pre-established. You can't manually set the pin in the right position. The # of options for the flag placement is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: dgantzler

customer_reviews.title: Best golf accessory investment I ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Charged it up, put it on and drove to the course ....Boom ! It’s on, best golf Accessory I ever purchased hands down w/o and fees. It took my steps too which was a bonus. You won’t regret it, especially with Prime price.
customer_reviews.author: Street Doctor

customer_reviews.title: i love this watch
customer_reviews.text: i had an old Garmin watch that was starting to give me problems, after about 5 years use. My old one was so good, that i never looked at another brand, when i shopped for this one. This new one is terrific. i love the score keeping and it even keeps driving distances and accuracy. It measures shot distances, which helps me in finding my ball. It keeps pitching accuracy, but I'm not so sure of this feature. No amateur golfer should play without wearing one of these, Thanks, Garmin
customer_reviews.author: BigGadgetGuy

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband who plays golf every weekend. He loves the golf functions and wearing it as his watch on weekends. It's too nice for him to wear to work (aircraft electrician). We lived in Japan when I purchased it and all the courses he played were found. Definitely recommend and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Oehlschlager

customer_reviews.title: Would want to play without my golf gps.
customer_reviews.text: This the second Garmin golf gps that I have had. This one is on the wrist. I would highly recommend this one over the other versions that are not on the wrist. It's just handier. My only hesitation is the battery. My previous model failed after around 18 months. Not acceptable. So far, the battery has not been a problem (but it's still early).
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Won't pair won't link to PC locked up, can't be returned.
customer_reviews.text: I got this last December for Christmas. When spring came I attempted to use it and it won't pair it gets locked up it won't connect when plugged to PC. I attempted to return, even though brand new and Amazon says it's too late. No support response after multiple attempts. DONT BUY. Mine was a complete lemon and waste of $100+. Stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Synchronization Problems
customer_reviews.text: The watch worked great with shot measure and distance. A big negative on the Synching feature. Unable to Sync for post round analysis for 2 weeks. Spoke with Garmin support x2 and no resolution. Response was “we know it is a problem and has been escalated to Software”. Very disappointed in Garmin that with the price paid for the watch, unable to use all of the functions. Will not buy from Garmin again. Just glad I did not buy the more expensive version.
customer_reviews.author: Don Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Functional watch. Helps a lot in case you are behind some structure and don't have line of sight to the hole (eg. in the wrong fairway). Bought it for $150 and think it is worth it. You cannot edit a shot later on so in case a shot is not tracked well it will cause some problems. In my case sometimes it does not switch to the next hole as a result of which the the drive distance etc. are calculated from the previous green (instead of the tee) screwing up the stats. This cannot be fixed later on. Battery lasts for around 3 round of 5 hours each.
customer_reviews.author: Jatin S.

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, great golf GPS. If you track your swings and score this watch is very useful. I play in a night league so its nice to track the history of what clubs I use on specific holes, especially par 3s. Using the app requires you to download the Garmin Connect app first and then the golf app that comes with it. Great battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Best watch ever.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch for golf and everyday use. Ditch your bulky and cumbersome range finder. (You are just going to lose it anyway.) This watch keeps score, shows distance to and over hazards, let's you keep detailed statistics, and best of all shows you your shots superimposed on the golf course after each round. And Garmin stands behind its products. When my wrist strap broke, I called the 800 number, and a few days later I had a free replacement. I recently bought one for my wife and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Use it 2-3 times per week, Battery lasts 27-36 holes no problem. Accuracy is good to within a couple of yards, plenty good for a mid-handicapper. Bought it to replace my Garmin S-1 that was about 5 yrs. old. Only reason to replace it was that the watch strap was part of the watch and when the strap broke, you're screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Fluffy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GPS WATCH FOR YOUR HOME COURSE
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this watch and used it at my home course for 3 rounds while also using a laser rangefinder. this was very accurate and helpful and I will likely quit using a laser rangefinder at well known courses b/c its so simple and handy. The battery lasted a full 3 rounds and the band is comfortable to wear. well done!
customer_reviews.author: Strugz

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: The battery charging is what I didn't want, but it seems that you have to charge it if you use a watch and not a rangefinder. The charge lasts easily for over 2 rounds using it as a watch and step counter in between. Using Garmin Connect and Garmin Golf apps on my Android automatically pulls over the score with whatever detail you add as you complete your round. This output on the phone is great even showing approximate distances of each shot. I would like to add the TruSwing sensor so my swing was analyzed to give me a better idea of what I do wrong, but it is a little expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Hinton

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: First golf watch and I'm not a watch wearer. Very comfortable! After 4 rounds in 4 days I keep looking at my empry wrist. Might just start wearing it all the time. My buddy had a Lazer range finder and they were pretty damn close!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Williams

customer_reviews.title: Recommend Highly
customer_reviews.text: Worked right out of the box, easy to learn, loaded courses and identified my home course - I live along course, and downloaded to nearest hole by the back of my house. Used at local course with same results. You get immediate distance as soon as the golf cart stops. This is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly U.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t come with a lot of instructions. Can’t figure it out. Cannot use it to play which is a shame. Thought it would be easy but I have to change manually the hole number, etc... I just surrendered and leave the watch in a drawer. I need something that will be easy enough hat I will not be focused on it during my golf , trying to understand how it works!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Belanger

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love it
customer_reviews.text: I really wrestled with the choice when I got this Garmin because there are several in the price range, and cheaper, that promise to do so much. This was the right choice! The distance is spot on, the many features are really an asset, and the battery life is all that I could hope for. I have gotten 3 rounds out of a single charge and worn it as a watch in between. I would recommend the Garmin S20 to any level golfer.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Haney

customer_reviews.title: Great watch/GPS.
customer_reviews.text: Had great reviews to begin with, plus I got it for a great price. Paired with my iPhone for notifications. Had a little trouble when first received, but cleared up after talking to Garmin rep. Works great on all the golf courses I play & I play 4-5 times/week. Highly recommend to any avid golfer. I wear it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Rick1034

customer_reviews.title: Good value, accurate
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for 8 rounds now and it is very accurate with yardages. Lots of options like distant to hazards, front/middle/back of green, layup distances. Only issue I’ve had is it wouldn’t register my swing on the tee box a few tImes no matter how many times I swung. Pretty easy to navigate thru the menus using the 4 buttons on the side of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Greg S

customer_reviews.title: Love this Garmin watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch does everything I need. Very accurate. I have about 15 rounds stored in my Garmin app since I purchased the watch. It may take two tries to find the satellites but once found picking the course is easy. I love the ability to score after each hole and see my shots in the Garmin app after the round. I purchased this on Father' Day so the price was great. Syncing with my Google pixel phone via blue tooth is painless. My golfing friends that have purchased Bushnell are jealous.
customer_reviews.author: Nprlisner

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Product stinks don’t buy it. Very hard to navigate in round information as far as distance to hazards, carry distances, green layout. Also the watch doesn’t always send your round results to the app in the phone, so you don’t get a shot by shot record of the club, distance and score of each hole of your round which is the only reason I purchased. Get the s60, this one is trash.
customer_reviews.author: kevin boyle

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far...
customer_reviews.text: Used the watch for one round so far. So far so good. Watch picked up the course easily and it was easy to navigate thru the functionality when needed. I took score, located hazards, measured shots....etc. Yardages were pretty accurate based on pin placements. Compared some of the yardages to friend's laser finder. Happy so far. Very light feeling on the wrist. Doesnt bother the swing at all. Battery life seems great. Been over 10 days since I first used it and still on 70% battery life
customer_reviews.author: N. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Liking this golf watch
customer_reviews.text: I was given this golf watch for Mother's Day. I really like it. It's performed better than I expected. I only had one issue with no courses showing up and when I called support it was resolved quickly. Not the golf watch but rather my error. I like that you can measure hazards. It's as accurate as my sky caddie without a subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Jaynet

customer_reviews.title: Great golf watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great golf watch for the price! Features are not abundant but it has a nice set. GPS for golf purposes is accurate and intuitive. I really like the sunrise and sunset feature. Step counter seems accurate and the Garmin Connect app that goes with the watch is actually pretty cool. Tracking score is simple and it of course syncs up with the app so you can easily review your games. It's a basic display but easy to read. But that's all I was looking for, if you want a color screen you will pay big bucks. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia D Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. No more guess work from the fairway. I downloaded Garmin Connect to my laptop, connected the watch and downloaded the courses. I have Tru Swing also. The 3-D imaging helped me locate a swing flaw and added some positive reinforcement when I discovered I have some healthy forward shaft lean at impact.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great Golf gift
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. Was recommended by my brother who has this model. Great reference tool for golfers. Has course layouts for most, if not all, US golf courses. Hole but hole layouts for planning your next shot. Lightweight and comfortable with a clear digital readout. Can even keep score. Perfect watch and golf aide.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch, great GPS and fantastic Battery!
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular product! Great Golf GPS. Accurate watch with button to light up screen at night. A Pedometer or step counter with instant conversion to miles. Best of all a long lasting battery. I have taken the S-20 as my only watch on 5-6 week trips abroad, played one or two rounds of golf while there and I have still had some battery power left when I come home. Far better than my old S-1, S-2 and S-3 which essentially run out of juice after one round of golf
customer_reviews.author: B.G. Staffan Lundback

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with product....took a few times using to get use to but once my learning curve was over have been very satisfied...tracks my shots and gives me that information later....use the step feature to try. and keep up my steps.....watch works fine....battery last couple weeks without need to recharge.....if I golf I try to have full charge but have played two rounds without recharging.....would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good golf watch
customer_reviews.text: Seems very accurate. "Ok, up, down, back" and buttons are fine, once you get used to them. Not interested in score keeping, but it keeps asking me if I want it. Watch is not big and clunky.
customer_reviews.author: OysterJim

customer_reviews.title: Loads quickly  and comes with step counter
customer_reviews.text: Loads quickly unlike last garmin. Distances are never precise with this type of watch, also steps are not counted accurately as I have have another watch and compared them
customer_reviews.author: GRAHAM MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing is it won’t cure a slice!
customer_reviews.text: Quickly adjust to the course you are playing. Check yardage’s ageist my range finder to make sure they were correct, they were. Easy to use, light weight. I only wanted it for front, middle and end of green measurements, however, it offers a lot more I.e. steps taken, miles walked, time of round. It was everything I wanted and there were really no disappointments.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Twain

customer_reviews.title: I should of got this years ago
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at how cool this is. So easy to use. Super fast. Used at 3 different courses and not one problem yet. Already had 2 strangers ask how to get one. Totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: The_greg85

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Much better than trying to shoot yardage with a hand held device which in many cases can't read the flag stick yardage plus more convenient than digging in my golf bag for the hand held yardage device.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: AVID GOLFER IN SO CALIFORNIA LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch as a Father's Day gift and he loves everything about it. It's very accurate, easy to read (even in the dark), and it's comfortable to wear. He recommends it to any Golfer who wants to fine-tune their accuracy. It was also reasonably priced, compared to other brands, considering all it does!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Credibility
customer_reviews.text: I bought Golf GPS garmin this summer, but not functioning now. I see GARMIN on face during charging, but no charging occurs. I hope you exchange this to new one.
customer_reviews.author: Yung H Koh

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how accurate this watch is
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Garmin Approach 20 golf watch and used it on my last golf outing. I can't believe how accurate this is. It gives the yardage from the tee to the front, center , and back of the green. When checked with a friends range finder it was dead on. I highly recommend this to the average golfer. For the price, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: david middlebrough

customer_reviews.title: Golf
customer_reviews.text: It has many golf courses and logs on it fast. For me however it is a little too complicated, gives too much other info that is not necessary during the play, maybe after it if you need it for analyzing your game
customer_reviews.author: ahajdu

customer_reviews.title: Basic smart watch with GPS capabilities
customer_reviews.text: Battery life for just watch/smart watch is as advertised. Same thing for on course. Pretty accurate yardage compared to playing partners range finder. Maybe a yard or two off.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted and so easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Battery life is way more than I expected. I get to a golf course and in about a minute, it is tracking the holes, keeping my score. Best part is it is very easy to read in the sun. Thinking of giving a couple to my golfing buddies. They keep asking me for yardage.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great help on distance to hole
customer_reviews.text: It is great on distance to hole if the course hasn't changed much it is a little cumbersome to get distance to layup, traps etc. I like it and if used with the smartphone app to keep a record of your rounds. It does not have a touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Fusco

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my Garmin G6 and needed a replacement. After talking to a Garmin Service rep I decided to buy a S20. Not as detailed as the G6, it is still a very good unit. Accuracy can be a little off on three of the holes but not that bad, Still within 4 yards. Does everything I need it to do at a competitive price. I can play36 holes and still have 80 % battery life left. I would definitely recommend this unit to anybody looking for a good range finder.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Wambold

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the ASS
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. Not user friendly. Pain in the butt to navigate. It will track your shots, just as long you remember to make sure that your focus in the round is the on watch on your wrist and not the actual game of golf you are playing. Sure, it gives you GPS distances, but so do a million other devices, most of them for free. Don't waste your money. I returned mine and got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hernke

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this watch. Love. It holds a charge forever, which was my main complaint on my last watch. Love the step counter, love the course uploads (fast) and everything about this watch. I've recommended it to all my golfing friends.
customer_reviews.author: Seagolfer

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome programming
customer_reviews.text: The programming to have to keep score to measure a shot is what I don’t like. I woul lake to measure A shot when I want to and not have to keep score to do it. I would also like if I could input my club set makeup. I only carry a heaven wood, 3-7 hybrids, irons 8.9.pwand 2 other wedges. Over all i don’t like it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Features
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this watch is to use. You do have to scroll up and down some to get to some of the features, but what I like most about it is the fact I sync up to my phone and can see a summary of my round, my distances and details. It's very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functionally good looking watch
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 3 year old Bushnell watch which I was very happy with. The S20 takes some getting used to but have found it to be more accurate ( within 2 yards of range finder) and battery gives me 2 full rounds. In fact played 36 holes a day, 5 days in a row on a buddy trip recently with a simple overnight charge. Love the large digital display and numerous functions. Purchased the blue model and have received numerous compliments as a watch off the course. Definitely can recommend this GPS watch.
customer_reviews.author: Don Apelian

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS Watch for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second GPS watch that I use for golfing. The battery last well over a week without recharging so much more efficient than my first Garman watch that I purchased for years ago. Excellent price for the money works great!
customer_reviews.author: sundevil

customer_reviews.title: Luv the shot tracking works great!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for the shot tracking and that works great. Not sure about the hazard accuracy. I had a creak in front of me ant it said 94 yards to reach and 120 to carry! NO way was this right.
customer_reviews.author: pcn

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Approach S20 GPS Golf Watch
customer_reviews.text: I did some research and found a few negative reviews but decided to buy this watch anyway. I'm glad that I did so far. I've used it for 7 rounds so far and very pleased with its performance. It finds the satellites quickly and loads the course quickly. Distances are within a few yards of other GPS devices (cart GPS, sprinkler heads, other GPS watches). I had a Bushnell Neo watch previously but I'm much happier with the Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Sylver

customer_reviews.title: Accurate distances and receives notification  from my Iphone while playing golf.
customer_reviews.text: I tried using it in three golf courses in the Philippines. Everything is okay when I used it at Forrest Hills Golf Course, while there are some errors at Beverly Place like Holes 1-9 in Garmin, are in reality Holes 10-18. At Veterans Golf Course, Holes 4, 5, 10 and 11 don't match Garmin. Except for these errors, I love using my new Garmin Approach S20 and even recommended to a friend who already bought one from Amazon at the new discounted price.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar G. Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Get this if you love golf
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it. He was super impressed with how customizable and accurate it was. Not to mention can wear on and off course. I even got one for myself so we don't have to share anymore! We live in rural Vermont and it has all the courses near us, even the little 9 holers
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Martin

customer_reviews.title: great golf,fitbit and watch
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new watch I needed a fitbit to track walking steps and mileage I needed a new golf yardage tracker I can't believe I got all of them in one device.n;
customer_reviews.author: keltickat

customer_reviews.title: Much better than thee original Garmin Golf watch.
customer_reviews.text: More functions. Easier and faster to charge. You need to take some time to understand how to work this version due to enhanced functions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.  Brown

customer_reviews.title: A little confusing
customer_reviews.text: Golf watch works fine but is confusing how to change modes from watch to golf and back. 4 different buttons which require you to remember which to push in the applicable mode to get where you want to be. To get to play golf, I am constantly turning the watch completely off and restarting it. I will say that compared to other golf watches it is much easier to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Rubinsohn

customer_reviews.title: He loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. He said the only thing he doesn’t like about it is, it doesn’t automatically update time zone. Your supposed to be able to turn off and when you turn back on, it doesn’t update.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great for score keeping, easy to use, quickly accessable distances
customer_reviews.text: I use it for distance control and for keeping score and it does these things effortlessly. It switches seamlessly from hole to hole and puts up the score keeping screen as you walk off the green. With a simple button up or down and a push of "OK" and your score is recorded for that hole. I have had other GPS units, but this is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Noel H

customer_reviews.title: really  hard  fiq  out  pain in a$&
customer_reviews.text: this thing is flat out frustrating from min you unbox if your buying for golf dont buy you have to fight with fitness part of the watch i wanted golf gps not a fitness watch
customer_reviews.author: Schecter

customer_reviews.title: So light you will forget you are wearing it...
customer_reviews.text: Holds a charge. Comfortable to wear. Takes a little practice to use all its functions, and is lacking good instructions, but patience will win out. While the strap keeper keeps the watch on securely, it also makes it difficult to take the watch off.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: accurate and simple
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate from anywhere on the course. Easy to use. Not too bulky (I hardly know it's there). It has worked on every course I've played too. (Vegas, FL, MA, NH, ME, and NC so far) I'd definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J B

product_meta.title: Garmin 010-03723-01 Approach S20, GPS Golf Watch with Step Tracking, Preloaded Courses, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Watch onlyApproach S20 is the golfing partner that doubles as your everyday watch. Stylish, sleek and lightweight, this versatile GPS device features more than 40,000 courses plus automatic map updates, daily activity tracking and smart notifications to connect with your healthy lifestyle. On the course, you’ll see precise distances to the front, back and middle of the green, as well as hazards. Garmin AutoShot round analyzer measures your shot distances and auto-records them for review on your Garmin Connect account. In addition, receive smart notifications for calls, texts, emails and other alerts right on your wrist.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Address：223-224, 2nd Floor, Jasola District Centre, New Delhi-110025 Monday – Friday：09:00 AM – 05:00 PM (Closed on Weekends and National Holidays) Action Camera Sales Related： +91-9205586122 Automotive Sales Related：+91-9205586116 Fitness Consumer Wearable and Outdoor Watches Sales Related：011-49863321 Outdoor & Marine Handheld：+91-9205586112 Marine Products：+91-9205586110 Outdoor Handheld, Marine, Action Camera & Automotive Service Related：+91-(0)11-48005813 Consumer Wearable & Outdoor Watches Service Related：1800-121-00-1818 (Toll Free Number)
feature_bullets: Autoshot round analyzer measures shot distances with auto recording for post round analysis on your Garmin Connect account
Stylish comfort: Fully hinged, sleek watchband design with comfortable fit. Display resolution: 128 x 128 pixels. Smartphone compatibility - iPhone, Android
Truswing compatible: When paired, Garmin TruSwing golf swing sensor provides metrics to improve your swing consistency. Display size: 0.9 x 0.9 (inches)
Activity tracking: Reminds you to stay active on or off the course with move bar alerts. Displays steps, calories burned, distance and time of day, plus it monitors hours of sleep
Stat tracking: Enhanced stats keeps track of fairways hit, greens in regulation and putts per round. Strap material: Silicone
Sunlight readable, high resolution, monochrome. Connectivity : Bluetooth Smart and ANT+

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,560 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
